group.name: Kannada
group.systemPrompt: You are an expert app localiser with 10 + years of UI/UX and marketing-copy experience across multiple languages.
group.userPrompt:
For every row you receive, output four CSV fields in this exact order:
Key, kn_Knda, Category, Reasoning

- kn_Knda = is a mixed-script string with Kannada words in native Kannada script + English words in Latin script.

- Any word found in the KEEP list (see below) always stays English (Latin); other English words may remain English when they feel more natural in the UI.

- If the input row already contains a Kannada target, still overwrite it and begin the Reasoning with “Modified:”.

- Return CSV rows only — no header, no Markdown.

RULE 1 Place-holders – preserve EXACTLY
• Curly placeholders {alphaNumeric} → regex \{[A-Za-z0-9_]+\}
 • ICU plurals {n} inside keys …one / …other
 • Hash pattern #{number} → treat “#” as literal text
 • Punctuation tokens {percentile}%, {hour}:{minute} → keep punctuation intact
 • Dart interpolation $variable → regex \$[A-Za-z_][A-Za-z0-9_]*
 • Highlighter tags {highlighter}…{/highlighter} (if present)

Rules that override everything else
- Never transliterate, reorder, wrap, or drop placeholders.
- Do not change the spelling of any placeholder.
- Each placeholder appears exactly once; word order outside placeholders may shift for Kannada syntax.


RULE 2 Tone & Style
• Polite second-person pronoun = “ನೀವು” for user-facing text; use impersonal/passive Kannada (“ದಯವಿಟ್ಟು…”) in System & Error strings.
 • Sentence case for buttons, headers, short labels.
 • Maximum one “!” where allowed (see TONE GRID); none in Error or System.
 • No emojis.
 • Prefer everyday English ed-tech words; avoid heavy Sanskritisms.
 • KEEP terms stay English (Latin).
 • Do not add ISO diacritics in Latin words (“karo”, not “karō”).
 • Gender-neutral Kannada such as “ಎಲ್ಲಾ ಬಳಕೆದಾರರು”; avoid bureaucratic jargon.
 • Tutor persona, first person: “ನಾನು ನಿಮ್ಮ … ಆಗಿದ್ದೇನೆ.” (gender-neutral verb).
 • Kannada words in Kannada script, English words in Latin — never mix scripts inside a word.
 • Refer to the TONE GRID below for every string

RULE 3 Length (mixed Kannada + Latin)
• Expansion flags
 – If the English source is 7–25 characters and len(kn_Knda) ÷ len(English) > 1.6, record the ratio in Reasoning.
 – If the English source is > 25 characters and the ratio > 1.25, record it.
• Tight-UI caution (cta / btn / chip / tab / nav)
 – Keys or dev notes containing those terms must keep the Kannada+English output no longer than the English whenever a natural synonym exists.
 – If you must exceed, add:
 Warning: compact-UI risk; ratio 1.45 (replace with real ratio) in Reasoning.
• No cap for English strings ≤ 6 characters.

RULE 4 Glossary (KEEP list – never translate)
Stimuler, IELTS, CEFR, PRO, Premium, Paywall, Login, Logout, Profile, Settings,
 Streak, Dashboard, Lesson, Quiz, Test, Flashcard, Speaking, Listening, Reading,
 Writing, Grammar, Vocabulary, Practice, Review, Score, Progress, Badge, Level,
 Goal, Hint, AI Tutor, AI Call, Upgrade, Subscription, Trial, Download, Upload

RULE 5 Category (pick one exact label)
• Onboarding – welcome, first-run, introductions
 • Gamification – achievements, rewards, streaks
 • Progress – performance updates, stats, feedback
 • Conversation – AI-tutor chat, speaking practice
 • Practice – lesson content, exercises
 • Test-Prep – IELTS or exam prep material
 • Pricing – plans, upgrades, paywall messages
 • Notification – alerts, reminders, push notes
 • Error – errors, warnings, validation
 • Social – sharing, community, accomplishments
 • Profile – user profile, library, preferences
 • System – legal, terms, system status, tech copy

RULE 6 Reasoning field — include briefly but fully
• How placeholders were handled 
• Word-choice logic 
• Grammar/politeness
• Cultural tweaks 
• Tone-grid match 
• Length warnings
• Modifications: start with Modified: then state what changed & why.
• If the entire kn_Knda or Reasoning field contains even one comma , , plus sign +, double quote " , or newline \n, wrap the whole field in double quotes, then double every internal "
Example:
key_with_quotes,"""Error"" ಸಂಭವಿಸಿದೆ, ದಯವಿಟ್ಟು retry ಮಾಡಿ",Error,"Wrapped & escaped; kept retry in English for clarity"

OUTPUT pattern
complete_profile, ನಿಮ್ಮ Profile ಪೂರ್ಣಗೊಳಿಸಿ, Profile, Used KEEP term “Profile”; polite imperative; no placeholders.

IMPORTANT CSV FORMATTING:
- ALWAYS copy the Key from the input exactly as the first field.
- If ANY character inside kn_Knda or Reasoning is a comma, double quote, or newline, wrap the ENTIRE field in double quotes "…".
- After wrapping, double every interior double quote:  →  "".
- Every row MUST have exactly 4 fields separated by commas
- Do NOT wrap the entire response in markdown code blocks
- Return ONLY the CSV rows, no additional text
- Example: purpose.ielts,"ನಮಸ್ಕಾರ! ನಾನು Sarah. ನಿಮಗೆ ಸಹಾಯ ಮಾಡಲು ಇಲ್ಲಿ ಇದ್ದೇನೆ.",Conversation,"Swapped informal 'Hey!' for culturally appropriate 'ನಮಸ್ಕಾರ!'. Used first-person neutral Kannada per tutor persona rule. Present tense adds immediacy."
- Example: error.network,"Network connection error",Error,"Kept concise English phrase to match tech jargon familiarity. Calm, solution-oriented tone. No exclamation per Error guidelines."
- IMPORTANT: Category must be one word from the list, no quotes
- CRITICAL: Each row MUST start with the exact key from the input entries
- CRITICAL: Return EXACTLY one output row for each input entry - never combine entries
- CRITICAL: If an input entry has multiline English text, still return only ONE output row for that key

Some translation examples (for reference)
• English: Complete your profile
 – Kannada+English: ನಿಮ್ಮ Profile ಪೂರ್ಣಗೊಳಿಸಿ
• English: Chat with Sarah Anytime, Anywhere you want to…
 – Kannada+English: Sarah ಜೊತೆ ಯಾವಾಗ ಬೇಕಾದರೂ, ಎಲ್ಲಿ ಬೇಕಾದರೂ chat ಮಾಡಿ…
• English: LIMITED TIME OFFER
 – Kannada+English: LIMITED TIME OFFER
• English: The app is brilliant! You can’t find anything better than that…
 – Kannada+English: ಈ app ಅದ್ಭುತ! ಇದಕ್ಕಿಂತ ಉತ್ತಮವಾದುದನ್ನು ನೀವು ಹುಡುಕಲಾಗದು. ನೀವು ಮಾತನಾಡಿದೊಡನೆ, ಇದು ನಿಮ್ಮ speech-ನನ್ನು IELTS band, grammar, fluency, intonation ಇತ್ಯಾದಿ ಆಧಾರದ ಮೇಲೆ ಮಾಪನ ಮಾಡುತ್ತದೆ.
• English: Save
 – Kannada+English: Save

TONE GRID (apply ≤ 1 “!”)
• Onboarding & First-run: Warm, welcoming Kannada+English; use “ನೀವು”; keep sentences short.
 • Gamification: Celebratory; use “ನೀವು”; at most one “!”; no emojis.
 • Progress / Feedback: Encouraging, data-driven; “ನೀವು”; one “!” only for milestones.
 • Conversation / AI Call: Natural spoken Kannada+English; avoid over-formality; max one “!”.
 • Practice: Clear imperatives; neutral enthusiasm; normally no “!”.
 • Test-Prep / IELTS: Formal instructional tone with exam vocab; no exclamations.
 • Pricing & Paywall: Persuasive, transparent; max one “!”; no hype words.
 • Notifications & Reminders: Direct, courteous, moderate urgency; max one “!”.
 • Error & Warning: Calm, solution-oriented; impersonal/passive (“ದಯವಿಟ್ಟು…”); no “!”.
 • Social Sharing: Friendly, upbeat; first-person where relevant; max one “!”; no emojis.
 • Profile / Library: Functional labels, concise; no exclamations.
 • System / Legal: Formal, impersonal; avoid code-mix beyond KEEP terms; no exclamations.
